features.name: Oracle's Curse
features.desc: Each oracle is cursed, but this curse comes with a benefit as well as a hindrance. This choice is made at 1st level, and once made, it cannot be changed. The oracle's curse cannot be removed or dispelled without the aid of a deity. An oracle's curse is based on her oracle level plus one for every two levels or {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} other than oracle.

features.name: Oracle Proficiencies
features.desc: Oracles are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Mystery
features.desc:
Each oracle draws upon a divine mystery to grant her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and powers. This mystery also grants additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This mystery can represent a devotion to one ideal, prayers to deities that support the concept, or a natural calling to champion a cause. Regardless of its source, the mystery manifests in a number of ways as the oracle gains levels. An oracle must pick one mystery upon taking her first level of oracle. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, an oracle learns an additional spell derived from her mystery.

features.name: Revelation
features.desc:
At 1st level, 3rd level, and every four levels thereafter (7th, 11th, and so on), an oracle uncovers a new secret about her mystery that grants her powers and abilities. The oracle must select a revelation from the list of revelations available to her mystery. If a revelation is chosen at a later level, the oracle gains all of the abilities and {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} granted by that revelation based on her current level. Unless otherwise noted, activating the power of a revelation is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against these revelations is equal to 10 + 1/2 the oracle's level + the oracle's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.

features.name: Additional Spells
features.desc: In addition to the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} gained by oracles as they gain levels, each oracle also adds all of either the {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} spells or the inflict spells to her list of spells known (cure spells include all spells with "cure" in the name, inflict spells include all spells with "inflict" in the name). These spells are added as soon as the oracle is capable of casting them. This choice is made when the oracle gains her first level and cannot be changed.

features.name: Final Revelation
features.desc: At 20th level, an oracle learns the final revelation about her mystery, granting her amazing powers and abilities. The nature of these {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} depends upon the oracle's mystery.

features.name: Recluse's Stride
features.desc: Your base {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} increases by 10 feet. At 5th level, once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} get a +20 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against the first {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. At 10th level, you can teleport to a medium distance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. You can teleport a number of times per day equal to 3 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.

features.name: Mystery
features.desc: A lone strider must choose a mystery that adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Fade from Memory
features.desc: At 7th level, whenever there are no enemies within 10 feet, you gain 20% {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. At 14th level, you instead gain 50% concealment for one round. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your oracle level.

features.name: Fade from Memory
features.desc: At 7th level, whenever there are no enemies within 10 feet, you gain 20% {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. At 14th level, you instead gain 50% concealment for one round. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your oracle level.

features.name: Mystery
features.desc:
Each oracle draws upon a divine mystery to grant her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and powers. This mystery also grants additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This mystery can represent a devotion to one ideal, prayers to deities that support the concept, or a natural calling to champion a cause. Regardless of its source, the mystery manifests in a number of ways as the oracle gains levels. An oracle must pick one mystery upon taking her first level of oracle. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, an oracle learns an additional spell derived from her mystery.

features.name: Skill Focus — Knowledge (World)
features.desc: You get a +3 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} involving {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g}. If you have 10 or more ranks in Knowledge (world), this bonus increases to +6.

features.name: Mental Acuity
features.desc: Your explorations into the secret mysteries of the world have granted you a preternatural understanding of all things — and you just keep getting smarter. You gain a +1 inherent {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} upon taking this revelation and another at every third oracle level gained thereafter.

features.name: Final Revelation
features.desc: Upon achieving 20th level, you achieve true enlightenment and become one with the universe. You receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. You become immune to confusion, exhaustion, fatigue, nausea, and sickened effects. You can take 20 on all Knowledge {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. Once per day, should you die, 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after dying you are reborn as a living example of the summoning of your chosen philosophy. Your body re-forms with all your equipment, and you return to life with maximum {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}.

features.name: Mystery
features.desc:
Each oracle draws upon a divine mystery to grant her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and powers. This mystery also grants additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} and other {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}. This mystery can represent a devotion to one ideal, prayers to deities that support the concept, or a natural calling to champion a cause. Regardless of its source, the mystery manifests in a number of ways as the oracle gains levels. An oracle must pick one mystery upon taking her first level of oracle. Once made, this choice cannot be changed.
At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, an oracle learns an additional spell derived from her mystery.

features.name: Master Herbalist
features.desc:
A divine herbalist has mastered countless alchemical techniques that supplement her divine powers and greatly aid her when she {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} the sick and wounded. She gains a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} equal to 1/2 her oracle level (minimum 1), and uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier in place of her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier when attempting Lore (nature) checks.
This ability replaces the additional class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} the oracle gains from her mystery.

features.name: Brew Potions
features.desc: Allows you to brew potions of {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} up to level 3 during {g|Encyclopedia:Rest}camping{/g}.

features.name: Master Healing Technique
features.desc:
At 7th level, whenever a divine herbalist {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} a living creature with her healer's way ability, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g} she can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} to remove certain conditions from the target, with each condition set having an accompanying Lore (nature) {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} (see the list below). Failure by 5 or more causes the target to become sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (if the divine herbalist is attempting to remove the sickened condition, this extends it by 1 round). Similarly, failure by 10 or more instead causes the target to become nauseated for 1 round or to have its existing nauseated condition extended by 1 round. A creature that cannot be sickened or nauseated cannot have conditions removed by this ability.
Minor Conditions (DC 20): Fatigued, shaken, and sickened.
Major Conditions (DC 25): Dazed and staggered.
Severe Conditions (DC 30): Confused, exhausted, frightened, and nauseated.
Dire Conditions (DC 35): Blinded, paralyzed, and stunned.
This ability replaces the revelation gained at 7th level.

features.name: Healer's Way
features.desc:
A divine herbalist combines alchemy, acupuncture, and divine magic to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds by {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 1 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, she uses positive energy to heal the target of {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} for every 2 oracle levels she has. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} unless the oracle targets herself, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. This ability counts as a paladin's lay on hands ability for the purposes of {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and effects that work with that class feature when it is used for healing purposes. Unlike lay on hands, this ability cannot be used to harm undead.
This ability replaces the revelation gained at 1st level.

features.name: Seeker's Trapfinding
features.desc: Seekers often look to ancient devices, old tomes, and strange magical items in order to learn more about their oracle mysteries. As a result of this curiosity and thanks to an innate knack at deciphering the strange and weird, a seeker gains {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as a class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g}. In addition, at 1st level, a seeker adds half his oracle level on Trickery skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (minimum +1).

features.name: Seeker Bonus Feat
features.desc: At 5th, 10th and 15th level, Seeker gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} from the list:

features.name: Powerless Prophecy
features.desc:
You are forewarned of danger but can't act to prevent it. You gain uncanny dodge, as the rogue class feature, but you are staggered for the entire first {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of combat.
At 5th level, you gain a +4 insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.
At 10th level, you gain improved uncanny dodge as the rogue ability, using your oracle level as your rogue level.
At 15th level, you gain a +4 insight bonus on all your {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and to your {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} during the first round of combat.

features.name: Two Minds
features.desc: You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects. At 7th level, the bonus increases to +4.

features.name: Celestial Armor
features.desc: At 7th level, a purifier's armor takes on a golden or silvery sheen and becomes light as a feather. Her armor weighs half as much as long as she wears it. She also gains armor training as a fighter 4 levels lower than her oracle level. At 11th level, a purifier gains heavy armor proficiency.

features.name: Sin Eater
features.desc: At 11th level, a purifier can consume a curse, enchantment, or emotion effect by {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}. She can do this a number of times per day equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier, and must make a dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to Charisma modifier against the effect. If the check succeeds, the effect is negated; however, the purifier is sickened for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}.

features.name: Sacred Scourge
features.desc: At 5th level, a purifier may channel holy power as a cleric of her level to harm evil outsiders . She may use this ability a number of times per day equal to 1 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.

features.name: Wind
features.desc: An oracle with the wind mystery adds {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.

features.name: Haste of the Wind
features.desc: Starting at 7th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} Wind Whisperer can affect all allies in a 30-foot radius with the haste {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effect for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This ability can be used once per day plus one more time for every six oracle levels.

features.name: Freedom of the Wind
features.desc: Starting at 15th level, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} Wind Whisperer can affect all allies in a 30-foot radius with the freedom of movement {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} effect for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. This ability can be used once per day plus one more time for every six oracle levels.
